alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Johnson; Magoffin; Menifee; Morgan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Morgan, west central Johnson, southeastern Menifee, northern Magoffin, northeastern Wolfe and south central Elliott Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 845 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greear, or over West Liberty, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lewis, Cottle, Caney and Cannel City around 850 PM EDT. Williams, White Oak, Matthew, Florress, Holliday, Harper, Lykins, Elamton, Netty and Jeptha around 855 PM EDT. Cisco, Bloomington, Wonnie, Orient, Logville, Haleburg, Patton, Bethanna, Kernie and Dingus around 900 PM EDT. Tella, Licksburg, Coon, Plutarch, Quod, Ever, Elsie, Gifford, Grayfox and Lacey around 905 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Salyersville, Cyrus, Brownlow, Perlie, Falcon, Stringtown, Leatha, Wheelersburg, Flat Fork, Niles and Oil Springs. THIS INCLUDES Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 57 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Elliott; Johnson; Magoffin; Menifee; Morgan; Wolfe
